posts.author: Iwan
posts.content:
Hello. 
While playing on high magic PW module - LON (Dawn of Heroes server), I've decided to create a cleric concentrated on spells. End game mobs have so high AC that trying to concentrate on magic and melee will make you medicore in both aspect. There are many builds that concentrate on fighting like Cleric/Bard/RDD but few try to make clerics offensive spells as deadly as possible. From what I've observed mostly used of them are - harm, bladebarrier and most importantly - implosion.  That decided about choosing spell schools - evocation and necromancy. To be effective in team and heal  party members, a cleric should stay alive by himself. To do it as long as possible I've decided to mix him with 16 lvl of Pale Master for AC bonus, crit immunity, surpsine attack immunity and  2 epic spells - epic mage armour and epic warding. I am aware that there are few such a combos in the base: 
Priestess of the Damned bard 4 / cleric 20 / pale master 16 (human) by I...Samphus
(Kiaransalee Drow Cleric) cleric 18 / bard 4 / pale master 18 (elf) by Nekroskop_
Combat Medic cleric 20 / bard 4 / pale master 16 (human) by Halston Vega
The Robust Reanimator cleric 20 / bard 4 / pale master 16 (dwarf?) by jjjhhhlll
Another Lite-Can Cleric! cleric 20 / bard 4 / pale master 16 (human) by krsboss
Archer Cleric cleric 20 / pale master 16 / bard 4 (human) by Tilbono
but none of them focuses on magic power.

Here is my little project. Tell me what You think. What can be done to make it more powerful?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I've seen Cler26/Bard4/PM10 caster clerics before but never Cler20/Bard4/PM16, usually because the extra caster levels help with resisting dispels and beating SR. If breach scrolls/wands are available then it should do okay.

On my caster clerics I usually go Magic/Trickery for Ice Storm, but with only 20 caster levels it might not be worth dropping Healing domain. If a lot of your opponents have Evasion then consider switching to Magic/Trickery.

Unless necromancy spells on your server are changed from vanilla NWN I would drop ESF: Necro and use those feats for something else. A 44 DC Implosion is more powerful than any of your necromancy spells and your high level slots can be filled with other spells like Blade Barrier or Harm. Replace the pre-epic focuses with Silent Spell and Empower Spell. Silent Spell lets you fill both your level 6 and 7 slots with Harm, I take it on almost all of my clerics. I would swap ESF: Necro and Armor Skin for another 2 G WIS feats. With that you will have 44 WIS when fully buffed which gives you an extra level 9 spell slot (so one more Implosion) and +1 DC.
Move SPen and GSPen to level 1, Extend Spell to level 3, and move SF: Evo and GSF: Evo to level 6 and level 9 respectively.
Move ESF: Concentration to level 21 and ESF: Evocation to level 24, you can move the G WIS feats to later levels.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content: Yunim speaks true.  Silent is golden.  And I also would drop Foci in Necro, unless they have some custom Necro things going on, like summons and the like.  Funnily enough, I think Evocation is the best case for most caster Clerics:  Hammer of the Gods, Empowered Flames, Empowered Blade Barriers, and mother of all death spells, Implosion.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
There is a lot of overlap between epic spell: mage Armor and cleric spells. This does not invalidate a 16 PM attachment to a primary cleric build but it why people often go the 26 cleric / 10 PM / 4 bard route. So you net the PM class feats but not the epic spells.

A deep cleric CL build helps spell penetration, spells last longer of course and a deep cleric build nets the cleric epic bonus feats for +Wis which is your DC. You can get to 52 Wis (capped) easish on a caster build. Add a Monk level to make it all AC applicable.

A high CL cleric also nets a high Spell Resistance (12+CL), so a 40th level cleric has a 52 SR. Or, more typically, a 38 Cleric has 50 SR. Not enough to stop a dedicated caster, but enough to stop all the hybrid casters.

If you are keen on a high DC caster cleric, I suggest taking a look at the Demolition build and altering it to meet your needs.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I think Yunim's, GDL's and Zanithar's comments are rather insightful and the Cleric Monk SD Mick Dagger is a good suggestion.

I don't know the environment you play in that world, but if it is high magic as you've written, with more than +5 AC bonuses then epic mage armor becomes less valuable.

PM 16 then becomes a decision whether those 6 PM levels are worth it for epic warding/4 AC/bonus feat. 

Also it is worth considering whether critical hit immunity and/or sneak attack immunity is available on items, if it is, then palemaster itself is rather unattractive.

I'd personally drop PM to 10, Cleric to 26 and Bard 4 as an ending skill dump with what I hear, and the others have made great suggestions already.

If there are good ranged weapons then zen archery could be rather attractive, and a cleric / rogue / monk zen archer could run circles around your opponents, sneak attack em, with quite high AB, spell penetration and spell DC from high wisdom.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I suggest moving ESF: Disc up to level 27 or 30, but everything else looks great.

As Mick Dagger suggested, Monk9/Cler26/SD5 is another solid defensive cleric build. Usually the best defensive healers are either Monk9/Cler26/SD5 or Cler26/Bard4/PM10, depending on your opponents. If the mobs hit very hard it might be tempting to switch to a CON focused Cler26/Bard4/PM10, you can get EDR3 and also pick up elemental resistances if elemental damage is a problem. The main downsides being that you will strictly be a healer/harmer with no DC spells and you will have less heals.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
It depends on the environment, but if dispelling is not a problem but mobs and sneak attackers are, then you could take PM earlier.

From level 21 take 3 bard levels to qualify, then take 10 PM levels to become crit and sneak immune. 

Also true sight/greater sanctuary is another solution if it works as in normal NWN. Does it work normally in your environment, or has it been nerfed?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: If you want to build for Spot you can swap Armor Skin for ESF: Spot, although you will need to rearrange your feats since ESF: Spot is only available at level 39. You can reach 48 Spot (21 ranks + 17 WIS + 10 ESF), which will be 88 with True Seeing and 98 at the skill cap. I don't know if 88 Spot is enough for your sever but it might be worth considering.
